value.title: Deploy and configure Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you’ll learn how to deploy and configure Azure IaaS Virtual Machine workloads. After completing the learning path, you’ll know how to plan, deploy, and upgrade Windows Server Azure Virtual Machines.

topItems.title: Plan and deploy Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to describe Azure compute and storage in relation to Azure VMs, and deploy Azure VMs by using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or templates.

topItems.title: Customize Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine images
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to create new VMs from generalized images and use Azure Image Builder templates to create and manage images in Azure.

topItems.title: Automate the configuration of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to deploy Desired State Configuration (DSC) extensions, implement those extensions to remediate noncompliant servers, and use custom script extension.

topItems.title: Upgrade and migrate Windows Server IaaS virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn to migrate a workload running in Windows Server to an infrastructure as a service (IaaS) virtual machine (VM) and to Windows Server 2019 by using Windows Server migration tools or the Storage Migration Service.

value.title: Deploy applications with Azure DevOps learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous delivery (CD) pipeline that automates the process of deploying your application.

images.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Design and create a realistic release pipeline that promotes changes to various testing and staging environments.

images.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Use a release approval in Azure Pipelines to help coordinate database schema changes between developers and database administrators.

images.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run Selenium UI tests, a form of functional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

images.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Deploy applications with Azure DevOps
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure release pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications.

topItems.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous delivery (CD) pipeline that automates the process of deploying your application.

images.title: Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Design and create a realistic release pipeline that promotes changes to various testing and staging environments.

images.title: Create a multistage pipeline by using Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Use a release approval in Azure Pipelines to help coordinate database schema changes between developers and database administrators.

images.title: Manage database changes in Azure Pipelines

topItems.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Run Selenium UI tests, a form of functional testing, in Azure Pipelines.

images.title: Run functional tests in Azure Pipelines
Create a release pipeline in Azure Pipelines

value.title: Develop IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central
value.excerpt: Interested in building end to end IoT solutions with Azure IoT Central, but aren't quite sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

images.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app

topItems.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central
topItems.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. We build the IoT Central app from a downloaded JSON file, defining all the device capabilities. Source code is also downloaded for the device app. The focus of this module is on creating rules and actions, to respond to certain telemetry input. Rules and actions enable greater automation of an IoT Central system.

images.title: Set up rules and take action on telemetry data in Azure IoT Central

topItems.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API
topItems.excerpt: The IoT Central REST API lets you manage applications programmatically. For example, you can add device templates, create devices, set device properties, send commands to devices, and manage data exports.

images.title: Manage IoT Central applications with the REST API

topItems.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
topItems.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from the "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you control a refrigerated truck. This module adds continuous data export to both Blob storage, and an Event Hub. Then, a Power BI app is built to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

images.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
Create your first Azure IoT Central app

value.title: Discover ways to foster an AI-ready culture in your business
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you will hear from top Microsoft executives about a framework to drive the key changes that are necessary to become an AI -ready organization. You will be able to identify the successful implementations of AI and articulate relevant scenarios. You will be able to discuss a line of business specific and relevant uses cases in finance, marketing, sales, and customer service. And finally, you will be able to identify  AI solutions to implement in your organization based upon its maturity.

topItems.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture
topItems.excerpt: A successful AI strategy must consider cultural issues as well as business issues. Becoming an AI-ready organization requires a fundamental transformation in how you do things, how employees relate to each other, what skills they have, and what processes and principles guide your behaviors. This unit is designed to help you understand which are the key elements that make a culture AI-ready and proposes a framework to drive that change in your organization.

images.title: Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance
topItems.excerpt: This module is designed for finance and affiliated business decision-makers to illustrate the impact of making strategic decisions with AI. The goal is to enable you to think about AI transformation holistically, with a focus on the cultural changes necessary to make AI transformation successful.

images.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in finance

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in marketing
topItems.excerpt: A successful AI strategy in marketing must consider cultural issues as well as business issues. The goal of this module is to enable you to think about AI transformation holistically, with a focus on the cultural changes necessary to make AI transformation successful.

images.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in marketing

topItems.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in sales
topItems.excerpt: A successful AI strategy in sales must consider cultural issues, as well as business issues. The goal of this module is to enable you to think about AI transformation holistically, with a focus on the cultural changes necessary to make AI transformation successful.

images.title: Discover how to foster an AI-ready culture in sales
Understand the importance of building an AI-ready culture

value.title: Distributed programming on the cloud
value.excerpt:
Learn about how complex computer programs must be architected for the cloud by using distributed programming.
In this module, you will:

Classify programs as sequential, concurrent, parallel, and distributed
Indicate why programmers usually parallelize sequential programs
Define distributed programming models
Discuss the challenges with scalability, communication, heterogeneity, synchronization, fault tolerance, and scheduling that are encountered when building cloud programs
Define heterogeneous and homogenous clouds, and identify the main reasons for heterogeneity in the cloud
List the main challenges that heterogeneity poses on distributed programs, and outline some strategies for how to address such challenges
State when and why synchronization is required in the cloud
Identify the main technique that can be used to tolerate faults in clouds
Outline the difference between task scheduling and job scheduling
Explain how heterogeneity and locality can influence task schedulers

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: What is distributed programming?
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about distributed programming and why it's useful for the cloud, including programming models, types of parallelism, and symmetrical vs. asymmetrical architecture.

topItems.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: MapReduce
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. MapReduce was a breakthrough in big data processing that has become mainstream and been improved upon significantly. Learn about how MapReduce works.

topItems.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: GraphLab
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. GraphLab is a big data tool developed by Carnegie Mellon University to help with data mining. Learn about how GraphLab works and why it's useful.

topItems.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: Spark
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's cloud developer course. Spark is an open-source cluster-computing framework with different strengths than MapReduce has. Learn about how Spark works.

images.title: Distributed computing on the cloud: MapReduce

value.title: Foundations of data science
value.excerpt: This path is intended for beginners that are looking to learn the basics of Python and Data Science

topItems.title: Learn the data science method
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the history and motivation behind data science

images.title: Learn the data science method

topItems.title: Introduction to Python using the datascience library
topItems.excerpt: Learn about programming and data types in Python

images.title: Introduction to Python using the datascience library

topItems.title: Create and manipulate tables using the datascience library
topItems.excerpt: Learn the basics of table manipulation in the datascience library.

images.title: Create and manipulate tables using the datascience library

topItems.title: Design and plot graphs in Python
topItems.excerpt: Learn about plots and graphs in Python

images.title: Design and plot graphs in Python
Learn the data science method

value.title: Implement a Windows Server hybrid cloud infrastructure
value.excerpt: You will learn how to address problems relating to the migration of on-premises workloads into Azure. After completing the learning path, you will be able to implement a hybrid Azure infrastructure.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid network infrastructure
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn to connect your on-premises environment to Azure, implement subnets and routing between your on-premises and cloud environments, and ensure that workloads in the cloud and on-premises perform DNS resolution to locate each other.

topItems.title: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server
topItems.excerpt: Implement hybrid identity with Windows Server

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises Windows Server instances to Azure IaaS virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to plan a migration and select appropriate server migration tools. You will also learn how to use Azure Migrate, how to assess physical servers, and how to migrate those servers.

topItems.title: Implement a hybrid file server infrastructure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll learn to deploy Azure File Sync, migrate from DFS, and use Storage Migration Services to migrate file servers to Azure.

value.title: Implement Windows Server hybrid cloud management, monitoring, and security
value.excerpt: This learning path addresses problems related to managing, monitoring, and securing a hybrid environment. After completing the learning path, you’ll be able to manage and maintain hybrid Azure and on-premises workloads.

topItems.title: Manage hybrid workloads with Azure Arc
topItems.excerpt: You will learn to describe Azure Arc, implement Azure Arc with on-premises server instances, deploy Azure policies with Azure Arc, and use role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict access to Log Analytics data.

topItems.title: Monitor Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines and hybrid instances
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to implement Azure Monitor for IaaS Virtual Machines in Azure, implement Azure Monitor in on-premises environments, and use dependency maps.

topItems.title: Audit the security of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn about Azure Security Center and how to onboard Windows Server computers to Security Center. You'll also learn about Azure Sentinel, security information and event management (SIEM), and security orchestration, automation and response (SOAR).

topItems.title: Manage Azure updates
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to enable Azure Update Management, deploy updates, review an update assessment, and manage updates for your Azure VMs.

value.title: Implement Windows Server IaaS VM Security
value.excerpt: This learning path deals with securing your Azure resources. After completing the learning path, you’ll be able to determine if your Azure IaaS workloads have any security vulnerabilities, and remediate those potential security vulnerabilities.

topItems.title: Audit the security of Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn about Azure Security Center and how to onboard Windows Server computers to Security Center. You'll also learn about Azure Sentinel, security information and event management (SIEM), and security orchestration, automation and response (SOAR).

topItems.title: Manage Azure updates
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to enable Azure Update Management, deploy updates, review an update assessment, and manage updates for your Azure VMs.

topItems.title: Create and implement application allowlists with adaptive application control
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to implement Adaptive application controls within your organization to protect your Windows Server IaaS VMs.

topItems.title: Configure BitLocker disk encryption for Windows IaaS Virtual Machines
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to configure Azure Disk Encryption for Windows IaaS VMs and back up and recover encrypted data.

value.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices
value.excerpt: The reliability of your systems, services and products has a direct impact on your success. Learn the modern operations principles and practices (and the Azure features that support them) that will help you achieve the level of reliability you need.

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: An introduction
topItems.excerpt: The reliability of your systems, services, and products are crucial to your success and the success of your organization. Learn how to approach those challenges.

images.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: An introduction

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Monitoring is the foundational practice you must tackle before you can make any headway with reliability. Learn what (and what not) to monitor to improve it using the tools available on Azure.

images.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Monitoring

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Incident response
topItems.excerpt: Everyone has incidents, but the top performing organizations know how to respond to them effectively. Learn the fundamentals of efficient incident response and the Azure tools that make them possible.

images.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Incident response

topItems.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Learning from failure
topItems.excerpt: Incidents will happen—there’s no doubt about that. The key question is whether you will treat them as a learning opportunity to make your operations practice better or just as a loss of time, money, and reputation. Learn the practice and the Azure tools that can help level up your operations practice by learning from failure.

images.title: Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: Learning from failure
Improve your reliability with modern operations practices: An introduction

value.title: Learn the business value of Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt:
Are you interested in learning about the cloud in an easy to understand way? Or perhaps you are confused about where to begin with cloud technology?
This learning experience will take you on  a journey that will begin by showing you how digital transformation and the power of the cloud can transform your business. We will cover how Microsoft Azure cloud services can power your organization on a trusted cloud platform. Finally, we will wrap up by illustrating how to make this journey real for your organization.
In this learning path, you will learn about:

Enabling digital transformation.
Identifying ways to migrate and modernize applications.
Gaining insights through data, artificial intelligence (AI) and the Internet of Things (IoT)
Meeting a broad set of regulatory and compliance standards on a trusted cloud platform.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure solutions
topItems.excerpt: Begin digital transformation by exploring why Azure is the right platform for your organization and the value Azure can bring. See how Azure enables you to empower employees, engage customers, optimize operations, and transform products.

images.title: Introduction to Azure solutions

topItems.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Every modern business is powered by applications, such as internal procurement applications, Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, retail websites, and third-party products. As your business prepares for digital transformation, it’s important to begin modernizing and migrating your applications and infrastructure to the cloud. Azure is a key component of that process. You can choose to migrate, modernize, or build cloud native solutions depending on your business goals and how you assess your application portfolio. This is a strategic decision. You’ll be able to choose the path that’s right for your organization.

images.title: Applications and infrastructure migration and modernization

topItems.title: Microsoft data estate migration and modernization
topItems.excerpt: Establishing a modern data estate is a foundational step toward digital transformation. A modern data estate enables timely insights and decision making across all your data, and sets the foundation for AI. A data estate is all of the data an organization owns. When you migrate this data to the cloud or modernize your environment on-premises you can gain important insights to fuel innovation.

images.title: Microsoft data estate migration and modernization

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure AI and demonstrates how Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure can help make AI real for your organization, whether you want to unlock insights from your latent data with knowledge mining, develop your own AI models with machine learning, or build immersive apps using AI.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Artificial Intelligence (AI) strategy and solutions
Introduction to Azure solutions

value.title: Migrate virtual machines and apps using Azure Migrate
value.excerpt: The Virtual machine and app migration using Azure Migrate learning path gives you a step-by-step process to help you understand, set up, assess, and migrate virtual and physical servers, databases, applications, and virtual desktops from on-premises to the Azure infrastructure. Azure Migrate now includes fully integrated and optimized migration-specific tools previously available only in Azure Site Recovery.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Migrate for server migration
topItems.excerpt: Discover how Azure Migrate helps you realize the benefits of moving your on-premises VMware or Hyper-V server workloads to Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS). Learn the process for migrating your workload agent-less, all within the hub.

images.title: Introduction to Azure Migrate for server migration

topItems.title: Set up Azure Migrate for server migration
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to check your prerequisite configurations in Azure and in your VMware vSphere environment and then perform the initial steps in Azure Migrate to choose your assessment and migration tools.

images.title: Set up Azure Migrate for server migration

topItems.title: Discover and Assess your on-premises servers with Azure Migrate
topItems.excerpt: Explore the Azure Migrate tools for discovering and assessing your virtual machine servers. Learn how to install and configure a virtual machine appliance in your virtualization host infrastructure.

images.title: Discover and Assess your on-premises servers with Azure Migrate

topItems.title: Replicate and migrate virtual machine servers with Azure Migrate
topItems.excerpt: Learn the process for replicating, testing, and finally migrating your virtual machines into production.

images.title: Replicate and migrate virtual machine servers with Azure Migrate
Introduction to Azure Migrate for server migration

value.title: Migrating open-source workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to migrate open-source workloads from PostgreSQL and MySQL databases to the equivalent services in Azure. Explore the processes and tools, and learn how to validate application dependencies to support a successful migration.

topItems.title: Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the issues and considerations for migrating on-premises open-source databases to Azure, the services that Azure provides to help you migrate your databases, and how to plan a migration.

images.title: Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure
Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure Database for MySQL
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the benefits of migrating MySQL workloads to Azure, you'll see how to create an Azure Database for MySQL instance, and learn how to migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure.

images.title: Migrate on-premises MySQL databases to Azure Database for MySQL

topItems.title: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL databases to Azure Database for PostgreSQL
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the benefits of migrating PostgreSQL workloads to Azure, you'll see how to create an Azure Database for PostgreSQL instance and how to migrate on-premises PostgreSQL databases to Azure.

images.title: Migrate on-premises PostgreSQL databases to Azure Database for PostgreSQL

topItems.title: Protecting, monitoring and tuning a migrated database
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to use the Azure features available for protect, monitor, and tune a database.

images.title: Protecting, monitoring and tuning a migrated database
Introduction to open-source database migration on Azure

value.title: Monitor and maintain Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine
value.excerpt: In this learning path, you’ll learn how to implement remote administration and management in Azure. After completing this path, you’ll be able to monitor your Azure resources, and plan for scale and high-availability.

topItems.title: Administer and manage Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine remotely
topItems.excerpt: You’ll be able to select and use suitable tools and techniques to remotely manage Windows IaaS VMs, and restrict administrative connections to those VMs.

topItems.title: Monitor Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machines and hybrid instances
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to implement Azure Monitor for IaaS Virtual Machines in Azure, implement Azure Monitor in on-premises environments, and use dependency maps.

topItems.title: Understand Windows Server IaaS Virtual Machine cost management
topItems.excerpt: You'll be able to use the Pricing calculator to assess likely costs, use Azure Advisor to monitor actual costs for Azure resources, implement Spot VMs and Azure Reservations, and describe benefits of Azure Hybrid licensing.

topItems.title: Implement scale and high availability with Windows Server VM
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn how to implement scaling for virtual machine scale sets and load-balanced VMs. You'll also learn how to implement Azure Site Recovery.

value.title: Monitor and optimize operational resources in SQL Server
value.excerpt: Configure hardware and server resources for optimum performance after establishing a baseline. Identify sources of performance problems. Troubleshoot using Azure SQL Intelligent Insights.

topItems.title: Describe performance monitoring
topItems.excerpt: Compare Azure and on-premises tools for monitoring and measuring performance. Determine critical metrics. Understand the purpose of a baseline for comparative analysis.

topItems.title: Explore causes of performance issues
topItems.excerpt: Explore the Query Store for tracking down problematic queries. Understand how SQL Server and Azure SQL manage currency by locking and blocking, or by using snapshots. Implement fragmentation checks and defragmentation.

topItems.title: Configure SQL Server resources for optimal performance
topItems.excerpt: Choose the appropriate size and storage options for your Azure SQL databases. Configure server resources such as tempdb. Understand the usage of Resource Governor.

topItems.title: Configure databases for performance
topItems.excerpt: Control database-level configuration options. Explore Intelligent Query Processing. Configure Open Source databases for optimum performance.

value.title: Perform data science with Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Learn how to harness the power of Apache Spark and powerful clusters running on the Azure Databricks platform to run data science workloads in the cloud.

topItems.title: Describe Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Discover the capabilities of Azure Databricks and the Apache Spark notebook for processing huge files. Understand the Azure Databricks platform and identify the types of tasks well-suited for Apache Spark.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: Understand the architecture of an Azure Databricks Spark Cluster and Spark Jobs.

images.title: Spark architecture fundamentals

topItems.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Work with large amounts of data from multiple sources in different raw formats. Azure Databricks supports day-to-day data-handling functions, such as reads, writes, and queries.

images.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Your data processing in Azure Databricks is accomplished by defining DataFrames to read and process the Data. Learn how to perform data transformations in DataFrames and execute actions to display the transformed data.

images.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
Describe Azure Databricks

value.title: Process natural language with Azure Cognitive Language Services
value.excerpt: Process natural language with Azure Cognitive Language Services

topItems.title: Add basic conversational intelligence to your apps by using Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS)
topItems.excerpt: Learn to identify valuable information in conversations with LUIS for interpreting user goals (intents) and distill valuable information from sentences (entities).

topItems.title: Manage your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn to manage LUIS apps through versioning, key management, handling data, and improving predictions.

topItems.title: Use containers for your Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) Apps
topItems.excerpt: The Language Understanding (LUIS) container loads your trained or published Language Understanding model. As a LUIS app, the docker container provides access to the query predictions from the container's API endpoints

topItems.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API
topItems.excerpt: Learn what your customers are really saying about your product or brand when they send feedback. We'll create a solution that uses Azure Functions and the intelligence of the Text Analytics API to discover sentiment in text messages.

images.title: Discover sentiment in text with the Text Analytics API

value.title: Threat Modeling Security Fundamentals
value.excerpt: This learning path takes you through the four main phases of threat modeling, explains the differences between each data-flow diagram element, walks you through the threat modeling framework, recommends different tools and gives you a step-by-step guide on creating proper data-flow diagrams.

topItems.title: Introduction to threat modeling
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective way to help secure your systems, applications, networks, and services. It's an engineering technique that identifies potential threats and recommendations to help reduce risk and meet security objectives earlier in the development lifecycle.

images.title: Introduction to threat modeling
Introduction to threat modeling

topItems.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
topItems.excerpt: Data-flow diagrams are graphical representations of your system and should specify each element, their interactions and helpful context.

images.title: Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements
Create a threat model using data-flow diagram elements

topItems.title: Provide Context with the Right Depth Layer
topItems.excerpt: Threat models can get complex if all parties involved cannot agree on a data-flow diagram depth layer that provides enough context to satisfy requirements

images.title: Provide Context with the Right Depth Layer

topItems.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
topItems.excerpt: Threat modeling is an effective technique to help you identify threats and ways to reduce or eliminate risk. We start by deciding to focus on either what needs to be protected or who it needs protection from.

images.title: Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
Approach your data-flow diagram with the right threat model focus
Introduction to threat modeling

value.title: Virtualization - Sharing cloud resources
value.excerpt:
Dive deeper into how the cloud works by understanding virtualization. How are computing power, memory, input and output, networking, and storage virtualized?
In this learning path, you will:

Get an overview of virtualization technology and how it is used in the cloud
Learn a formal definition of virtualization and its different types
Understand how CPUs are virtualized
Understand how memory is virtualized
Understand how I/O is virtualized
Understand how storage and networking is virtualized

In partnership with Dr. Majd Sakr and Carnegie Mellon University.

topItems.title: Share cloud resources
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

topItems.title: Understand virtualization
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

topItems.title: Virtualize computing power
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn about how computing power is virtualized using virtual CPUs. Covers different types of CPU virtualization.

topItems.title: Virtualize memory
topItems.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Learn how memory is virtualized to support cloud resources. Covers different types of memory mapping and related issues.

value.title: Working with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces you to connected Field Service and Azure IoT. Included in this learning path is identifying exceptions, register and manage devices, remotely monitor and service equipment, and using IoT central with connected Field Service.

topItems.title: Get started with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: This module gets you started with Connected Field Service and Azure IoT

images.title: Get started with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and service customer equipment with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: This module will focus on the end-to-end process of remotely monitoring IoT enabled devices using the Connected Field Service solution including device registration, working with alerts, and designing processes to take specific actions.

images.title: Remotely monitor and service customer equipment with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT

topItems.title: Register and manage customer devices with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
topItems.excerpt: This module will focus on IoT Device registration and monitoring using the Connected Field Service solution including device registration (physical and non-physical), working with device twins, and streamlining device management and interactions.

images.title: Register and manage customer devices with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT

topItems.title: Using IoT Central with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365
topItems.excerpt: This module focuses on using IoT Central with Connected Field Service add-on for Dynamics 365 for Field Service.  The module walks you through building an IoT Central application and escalating the alerts into Dynamics 365.

images.title: Using IoT Central with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365
Get started with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT

value.title: Automate Azure tasks using scripts with PowerShell
value.excerpt: Install Azure PowerShell locally and use it to manage Azure resources.

images.title: Automate Azure tasks using scripts with PowerShell

value.title: Manage and control traffic flow in your Azure deployment with routes
value.excerpt: Learn how to control Azure virtual network traffic by implementing custom routes.

images.title: Manage and control traffic flow in your Azure deployment with routes

value.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: In this module, we discuss how to create a Linux virtual machine using the Azure portal.

images.title: Create a Linux virtual machine in Azure

value.title: Deploy and run a containerized web app with Azure App Service
value.excerpt: Create a Docker image and store it in a repository in Azure Container Registry. Use Azure App Service to deploy a web application based on the Docker image. Configure continuous deployment for the web app by using a webhook that monitors the Docker image for changes.

images.title: Deploy and run a containerized web app with Azure App Service

value.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory
value.excerpt: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

images.title: Manage users and groups in Azure Active Directory

value.title: Move Azure resources to another resource group
value.excerpt: Identify Azure resources that you can move to a different resource group. Use the Azure portal to move resources.

value.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: Azure virtual machines (VMs) enable you to create dedicated compute resources in minutes that can be used just like a physical desktop or server machine.

images.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure

value.title: Deploy Azure virtual machines from VHD templates
value.excerpt: Standardize and automate your virtual machine deployments to minimize manual configuration, variance, and errors.

images.title: Deploy Azure virtual machines from VHD templates

value.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the different jobs roles associated with creating, managing, and using databases. You learn about the key responsibilities of these roles, and the tools that these roles use.

images.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data
